answers.answer: Hi there!It is normal for the penis to tilt to one side and have prominent appearing veins when erect and should not be anything to worry about. Erectile and ejaculatory dysfunction could occur due to a few causes such as psychological stress, performance anxiety, depression, neurogenic disorders peyronie's disease, body image issues, medications, alcohol, smoking, drugs/medications, hormonal imbalance, radiation therapy, kidney failure, metabolic disorders, multiple sclerosis, hypertension, diabetes, prostatitis, urethritis etc. just to name a few. Anxiety and stress play an important role in the development of erectile dysfunction; and is the most common possible cause. At a primary level, I would suggest being a bit relaxed and working on the psychological factors with your partner. You could also see a psychotherapist/ behavioral therapist for the same. It might also be beneficial to get rid of factors like smoking/ alcohol/ drugs, if involved. In case this doesn’t work, or you have difficulty controlling anxiety; I would suggest seeing your primary care physician or a urologist for an evaluation of the above mentioned causes and appropriate specific treatment.Hope this helps.Take care!

question: Im 21 years old when I was younger I use to masterbate a lot probaly close to 2 times a day or at the least one.  As I got older and got girl friends i stopped but noticed that my penis curves to the left and has a pertruding vein at the base of the penis only when I am hard.  There is not nearly as much sensitivity on the left side as on the right.  Im wondering if its permantely damaged or there is any natural or surgical treatments that can help with the problem.  Im still able to maintain an erection and ejaculate by holding an erection while standing up is harder.
title: Penis problem
